title: Presentations from parallel workshops by moderators

author: Fedor Ragin, IMISP - International Management Institute of St-Petersburg

segmentation: Our workshop was a series of case studies, four of them and.
Those case studies were.
Intended to look into details of executive programs in different business schools and also study.
Discuss a wider context, global challenges, and.
So it sort of values in this area.
So who were the contributors?
1st first of all it was Doctor Richard Fleming from Exeter University Business School.
Then it was Doctor Bogdan Boots and from Ukraine doctor Hans Will Smith from Leadtek Radio School of Management, Germany and I was moderating the workshop.
Representing International Management Institute of Saint Petersburg.
Of Russia, so I will begin, briefly describe each of the case studies and start with what Doctor Lemming?
Stealing us.
He started with challenges for business schools, which provides executive programs and their responses.
His speech was about a wider context and what I just called eternal values.
You said that there are certain sustainability challenges and economic and financial challenges that business schools face, encounter, social and leadership challenges.
Well, he described certain responses that Exeter Business School has in order to confront those challenges, like investing in research and integrating the results of these thresholds.
Research into programs.
Also, cooperation with the World Wildlife Fund, which is very interesting to me.
New programs addressing global change in economic and finance, the old capitalism model should be rethought.
That was the message from him.
And this rethought idea.
These ideas, new ideas should be put into new programs, social challenges, challenges.
Will lead to integration of inequality and demography.
Issues into executive programs.
That was a message of Doctor Lamming market challenges the situation.
In the one where the school is located as follows, 20% down and open market programs, which is not the biggest figure which I thought they heard about today.
Well, there is a certain clear need for tailor made programs for corporate customers.
Need to link programs to research.
That's what the market challenges are and pedagogical or how we teach challenges.
Finally, they would call for.
Learning experience, not programs.

This is the difference stressed by Doctor Lam Lam, Lam ING a concepts, not techniques that what should be in the programs and the new teacher teaching global technologies shows which blink programs to global context.
And another thing that speaker stressed was this name.
The notion of executive programs?
It should not be.
Executive programs with the Big E Becausw the Times changed.
It should be small E executive programs, but not programs for executive which was shared by the whole audience and everybody agrees with that.
So this was the messages.
This word messages by the first speaker, second speaker, Doctor, Bogdan Bosom from Ukraine.
Found him his inspiration in several sources.
First of all, it was International Institute of Business, Ukraine State University of Management is Russian International Academy of Business and his own company Management Consulting Center.
So using those sources.
He presented a case study which.
Let him express his opinion how business schools should respond to the crisis challenges.
First of all, understand the environment.
Or by doing constant resource monitoring and knowing the customer, develop substantial, inflexible programs full of actual cases.
That's #2 next point in the outline.
Business schools have to have processors who possess not only theoretical knowledge, but relevant practical experience which is not always easy task to complete.
Also, business schools should offer revised portfolio of programs which.
Different duration, timing and context, and finally to offer a more philosophic and global approach.
So this is the.
Way business schools should respond according to Doctor Bulson and.
She gave an example of a corporate customer which was Anheuser Busch as Beer Brewery Ukrainian.
Part of this company.
This Corporation and these corporate program for this customer by International Institute of Business.
It was program 8 months long, 8 modules for 48 managers of different levels in the hierarchy of the company.
Eight top managers.
They receive two or full time now days of how to make effective decisions on how to make effective decisions in the time of crisis.
This was part one and the 40 middle level managers.
They had those eight modules of two days each over 8 months in more or less traditional functional areas, so this was a success.
Obviously in the time of crisis when the demand from carpet customers.
Or education sometimes 100% down none but.
In this case, they got the contract and they learn certain lessons out of this.
Case first of all, first of all.

The Business School demonstrated their knowledge of the current market position and the customer was convinced that these guys from the business schools are competent enough to be talking to their managers business called established direct contact with decision makers, which is probably.
Case is reason #1Y1 gets a contract with the corporate customer.
Business will provide effective control to ensure the quality of education process which is often neglected.
I mean the situation known to me from Russian experience.
This was a stressed in this particular case and lead to success eventually.
Business School run in process performance evaluation.

Then it maintained a close contact with the HR Department just to keep this process running smoothly and the business will keep close relations with program graduates, graduates and management to ensure to get future contracts.
So this was a lessons.

By the Ukrainian Business School presented by Doctor Bulson, presenter number three it was Doctor Hans Will Smith from Labs Graduate School of Management an he described the changeable situation in Germany with the executive programs open market or open enrollment programs in Germany are still losing market shares.
Marking positions.
So it's still not good.
TaylorMade corporate programs are about to start growing or just returning, recovering maybe, but it's not yet as a general case for Germany.
However, at his school the situation is better and there are certain reasons for that.

This case, first of all, they noticed certain deley demand for executive programs at his school from the open market and they are getting more and more inquiries for that program for those programs for January and later months of the next year, I would like to mention here that we see the same trend in Russia.
People are not ready to pay right now, but they are ready to be put on the waiting list.
For the next year.
I.
Also.
At these Graduate School of Management of Leipsic, TaylorMade and company programs is a growing part of the portfolio, which is probably thanks to there.
Long history and certain approach to customers.
Doctor Hans Whisman believes that.

First of all, it was a good idea to establish specialized Department subsidiary called HL Executive which deals or busy with this executive programs 100% both for the open market and for corporate customers.
Second item of explaining this success or better position across the industry is privileged treatment of the customers and finally.
As it is transparent marketing.
Explaining what is this?
It was, well, the answer was very simple.
We are honest in managing expectations.
We perform to the level we promise and whatever we say is done.
So this is this has been for the last 110 years at this recognizable Business School or educational institution.
So that's the simple simple explanation of this success.
Case number four was bought from Russia.
I presented that and briefly describe what we are and it is all here were privately owned Business School established 20 years ago.
We are niche top segmentary into Business School working for both for open and corporate markets.
We don't have undergraded products programs in our portfolio.
Not anymore, because we had them once, but we quit.
But we do have executive programs and be EMBA and management consulting attached to those programs.
Full-time faculty is about 30 and 10 full-time consultants which are not professors, they're consultants, and also part timers.
The share of executive programs in our portfolio.
As for the last year, less academic year was 20, about 25 percent, 25% in the turnover is not that big.
Million euro so this is what we are, what we see.
In Russia, well again, it's it is our point of view.
Our perception of the situation demands shifted over the year over the last year.
If we take a program executive program and try and characterize it in four aspects.
First of all, whether it's more specialized or more in general, management just general over the industry.
Just about this general management.
So it moved towards specialized market.
Once more specialization.
A second if we speak about the share of personal personal consulting or just personal.
Opinions from the professors towards particular participants of the program.
So the shift is also visible.
People need, or people want demand more consulting within the programs, even from the open market, which from the open market which is not usual, which is not usual.
Normally it comes from carpet customers.
Next short term programs are preferred as opposed to long term programs before and.
Speaking about describing the essence of the program, whether it is an investment.
In myself, that's what the guy from market might think.
Or just something interesting for self actualization.
So it is it is just a blunt investment.
Just give me a paper, give me a diploma which would be a universally convertible tool for me.
That which is which could serve a proof that I spent my money in the times of crisis.
Not for nothing but for something.
So this is a shift as we see it.
The market, but what is happening in the industry if I call can call the Group of business schools providing this executive programs and in Russia this industry has never been consolidated.
It wasn't enough time for that, but it became after the crisis after the year of the crisis.
Even more deconsolidated, this means that early leaders lost their market shares and smaller providers like agents or.
Training centers, they just quit.

Many of them disappeared from the map of the industry, Business School executive program portfolios are being restructured in different ways in different ways depending upon what business schools see around them and how they how they feel with their strategies.
Comfortable and not so.
There were, especially in the last four.
Many anti crisis programs quickly made and I must say sometimes low quality renamed old products.
So I think they're they failed and now something new is knocking on the door and what it is.
Nobody really knows.
Competitive strategies are being reshaped towards price based.
It was always talk about differentiation, additional values and.
All this nice things, but when it comes to price in the terms of crisis, it works very well.
I just.
Decrease my price and every.
Is good alright?
So our response is the I'm finishing.
No Antichrist stuff in portfolio principle.
Unchanged market position and schools, brand perception, niche upper segments personally branded full time faculty.
It was the characteristic of ours and it sustains this way regardless of course this expensive.
But we paid this price strong metrics with the additional power to program managers.
Now they influence the market positioning.
Completed the stretches of the programs they run and contents and contents, open markets and in company markets, so two different strategies that we pursue.

First of all, we on the open market, we offer shorter programs with 7500 hours for smaller groups, 10 students and or about in order to integrate consulting so we are able to talk to this 10 people for two or three hours.
After the program personally.
Anne states certificates.
That's what they want.
Is approved today University convertible.

Not this way in the corporate sector, we focus on the 1st Echelon businesses in industries as opposed to medium level medium companies before offering programs as cash replacement tool for the managers that are to stay in the company.
So with decreasing wages and missing bonuses with the need of certain motivate new motivators in companies.
We come up with this programs as motivators not cash motivators and this works.
I must say extremely flexible and pricing.
And in terms of certificate policy, they're not convertible, they're made for the companies, so they cannot be used outside the company.
So people stick to their bosses.
That's what we pursue.
In the corporate market and the general discussion outline, first, we notice that crisis.
Just OK, so we have.
Just lifetime eternal challenges, which are existing regardless of the.
ISIS and the crisis itself can be dealt with in pretty easily in the short term, so we have had a very optimistic workshop.
Thank you very much.
